meanings.definition: The act of burning something completely
meanings.sent1: The incinerations in the factory were done to dispose of waste materials.
meanings.sent2: After the fire, only ashes remained from the incinerations.
meanings.sent3: The incinerations of the old documents made the office feel warmer.
meanings.sent4: Her anger was like incinerations, leaving nothing but scorched emotions in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The incinerations of the forest were so intense that the trees turned to charcoal.

meanings.definition: The result of burning something completely
meanings.sent1: The incinerations left behind a pile of ashes.
meanings.sent2: The incinerations of the trash were evident in the charred remains.
meanings.sent3: The incinerations of the marshmallows over the campfire were a delicious mess.
meanings.sent4: The incinerations of his dreams left him feeling empty and lost.
meanings.sent5: The incinerations of the building were so thorough that only rubble remained.
